channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: As hundreds of millions of birds head south, the invisible danger is glass
item.description: It's the peak of the fall migration season. This is when bird deaths from window collisions tend to spike, even though simple solutions can prevent this.
item.content:encoded:
It's the peak of the fall migration season. This is when bird deaths from window collisions tend to spike, even though simple solutions can prevent this.

(Image credit: Angel Ruszkiewicz)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Trump and Zelenskyy to meet. And, John Bolton indicted for mishandling classified info
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and President Trump meet today to discuss Ukraine's request for long-range missiles. And, John Bolton indicted for allegedly mishandling classified information.
item.content:encoded:
President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and President Trump meet today to discuss Ukraine's request for long-range missiles. And, John Bolton indicted for allegedly mishandling classified information.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Former Japanese PM Murayama, known for apology over wartime aggression, dies at 101
item.description: Tomiichi Murayama, Japan's prime minister from 1994, was best known for the "Murayama Statement," an apology delivered on the 50th anniversary of Japan's World War II surrender.
item.content:encoded:
Tomiichi Murayama, Japan's prime minister from 1994, was best known for the "Murayama Statement," an apology delivered on the 50th anniversary of Japan's World War II surrender.

(Image credit: Naokazu Oinuma)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Zelenskyy is set to meet Trump at the White House. Here's what to expect
item.description: When Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with President Trump on Friday, the mood is expected to be very different from their first Oval Office encounter in February.
item.content:encoded:
When Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with President Trump on Friday, the mood is expected to be very different from their first Oval Office encounter in February.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Our quiz writer digs deep on politics and ... bowler hats. Can you score 11?
item.description: What do you know about marathoning seniors, Diane Keaton's fashion choices and Taylor Swift sales? Find out!
item.content:encoded: What do you know about marathoning seniors, Diane Keaton's fashion choices and Taylor Swift sales? Find out!
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: 'No Kings' organizers project a massive turnout for this weekend's protests
item.description: Organizers say they expect millions of Americans will march this weekend against the policies of the Trump administration. The protests come amid National Guard deployments in several cities.
item.content:encoded:
Organizers say they expect millions of Americans will march this weekend against the policies of the Trump administration. The protests come amid National Guard deployments in several cities.

(Image credit: Ringo Chiu)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: In small towns and rural communities, young voters say they feel unseen by leaders
item.description: Gen Z and millennial voters will make up more than half of the electorate in 2028. They're a crucial bloc for both parties, but many are facing daunting economic realities and feel unseen by leaders.
item.content:encoded:
Gen Z and millennial voters will make up more than half of the electorate in 2028. They're a crucial bloc for both parties, but many are facing daunting economic realities and feel unseen by leaders.

(Image credit: Kirsten Luce for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Senators will force a vote to prevent war on Venezuela without approval from Congress
item.description: Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia says new legislation is needed to prevent the Trump administration's escalating actions against Venezuela from leading to war.
item.content:encoded:
Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia says new legislation is needed to prevent the Trump administration's escalating actions against Venezuela from leading to war.

(Image credit: Federico Parra)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Coffee transformed her life — and the lives of women from her village in Uganda
item.description: Meridah Nandudu was a single mom of two kids, unemployed and in despair. Then she had an idea: Maybe the "humble" coffee beans she'd grown up with on her parents' farm could lead her to a better life.
item.content:encoded:
Meridah Nandudu was a single mom of two kids, unemployed and in despair. Then she had an idea: Maybe the "humble" coffee beans she'd grown up with on her parents' farm could lead her to a better life.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: With some shutdown pain points delayed for now, talks in Congress are 'nowhere'
item.description: Some key impacts of the shutdown have been pushed back by moves by the Trump administration. But those efforts are temporary, and the pain could spread depending on how long the stalemate lasts.
item.content:encoded:
Some key impacts of the shutdown have been pushed back by moves by the Trump administration. But those efforts are temporary, and the pain could spread depending on how long the stalemate lasts.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh
